page.title: 06FARMING IN HAMBLEDON
page.content: {Hambledon Vineyard {Owned by:}Sir Guy Salisbury-Jones. {Started in:}1951. Acreage: 7.3 {Reasons for Vine cultivation: 1. S.E. facing slope. 2. Good drainage. 3. Chalk and clay soil. Five varieties of vine are cultivated. {No. of vines grown: }21,000. {Work carried out annually in Vineyard: Pruning, repairing trellis work, tying vines, weeding, fertilizing, spraying, training vines through trellis, harvesting. {Average quantity harvested:}24 tonnes. {After harvesting grapes are: 1.Taken to vinery. 2.Crushed. 3.Pressed. 4.Fermented. {Type of wine produced:}dry white table {No. of people employed:}2 permanent. {Seasonal labour:}18 Harvesting. 1 Bottling {Market for product:}International.
